children.name: hasVerbalIdentity
children.definition: Encodes how the brand speaks and behaves in written and conversational form — across all channels, including LLMs, assistants, and web content.

children.name: toneOfVoice
children.definition: Emotional texture of brand voice. Guides the tone and mood used in all brand communications.

children.name: dialogueStyle
children.definition: Preferred conversational approach the brand uses when interacting with its audience.

children.name: writingStyle
children.definition: The specific manner in which the brand's written content is crafted, including grammar, punctuation, and sentence structure.

children.name: namingConvention
children.definition: Standardized rules and guidelines the brand follows for naming products, services, and other entities.

children.name: personaCard
children.definition: A detailed profile representing the brand's archetype, including attributes, behaviors, and communication preferences.

children.name: approvedTerms
children.definition: A curated list of words and phrases that are sanctioned for use in brand communications.

children.name: prohibitedTerms
children.definition: A list of words and phrases that are discouraged or forbidden in brand communications to maintain brand integrity.

children.name: keyMessages
children.definition: Core statements that encapsulate the brand's primary value propositions and messaging priorities.

children.name: taglines
children.definition: Short, memorable phrases that capture the essence of the brand and are used consistently across marketing materials.

children.name: promptScaffold
children.definition: Structured templates or frameworks designed to guide AI in generating brand-consistent content.

children.name: mustDos
children.definition: Essential practices and guidelines that must be followed to ensure brand consistency in communications.

children.name: mustNotDos
children.definition: Practices and behaviors that are prohibited to prevent misrepresentation or dilution of the brand.

children.name: hasVisualIdentity
children.definition: Encodes the brand’s visual language in a machine-readable format — enabling consistency across generative media, UI frameworks, assistants, and visual rendering engines.

children.name: brandName
children.definition: The official name of the brand as it should appear in all communications.

children.name: logo
children.definition: The primary visual symbol representing the brand, including variations and usage guidelines.

children.name: colourPalette
children.definition: The set of primary and secondary colors that represent the brand's visual identity.

children.name: typography
children.definition: The specific fonts and typographic styles used in brand communications.

children.name: iconography
children.definition: The style and usage of icons that represent the brand's services or features.

children.name: imageryStyle
children.definition: The guidelines for photographic and illustrative content that align with the brand's aesthetic.

children.name: motionRule
children.definition: The principles governing animation and motion design elements in brand materials.

children.name: visualToken
children.definition: Reusable design elements such as colors, typography, and spacing that ensure consistency.

children.name: visualUsageGuidelines
children.definition: Comprehensive rules and best practices for applying visual elements across various media.

children.name: visualReferenceLink
children.definition: A link to external resources or documents that provide visual references for the brand.

children.name: hasAudioIdentity
children.definition: Encodes the brand’s sonic expression in a structured, machine-readable format — enabling consistent brand presence across speech synthesis, voice agents, virtual assistants, and generative audio platforms.

children.name: audioLogo
children.definition: A short, distinctive sound or musical phrase that represents the brand.

children.name: voiceSignature
children.definition: The unique vocal characteristics and style that embody the brand's persona.

children.name: pronunciationGuides
children.definition: Instructions on how to correctly pronounce brand-specific terms and names.

children.name: audioCue
children.definition: Specific sounds used to signal actions or transitions in brand communications.

children.name: speechStyle
children.definition: The manner and tone of spoken communication that aligns with the brand's identity.

children.name: audioReferenceLink
children.definition: A link to audio samples or references that exemplify the brand's audio identity.

children.name: audioUsageGuidelines
children.definition: Guidelines outlining the appropriate use of audio elements in brand materials.

children.name: hasPositioning
children.definition: Encodes the strategic intent, values, audience targeting, and narrative structure of the brand — providing clarity for AI agents, assistants, and retrieval systems to understand and represent brand meaning with context.

children.name: missionStatement
children.definition: Why the brand exists — its deeper purpose beyond commercial objectives.

children.name: visionStatement
children.definition: The long-term aspiration of the brand — the future it seeks to help create.

children.name: coreValues
children.definition: The ethical principles and beliefs that guide the brand’s decisions and actions.

children.name: brandPromise
children.definition: The core commitment the brand consistently makes to its audience.

children.name: audiencePersona
children.definition: Structured profiles representing the brand’s ideal customer types or user segments.

children.name: marketPosition
children.definition: The brand’s stance and differentiation in its competitive landscape or category.

children.name: brandNarrative
children.definition: The origin story, journey, and meaningful arc that defines the brand’s identity and message.

children.name: competitorContext
children.definition: An outline of how the brand compares to and differentiates itself from key competitors.

children.name: hasGovernance
children.definition: Defines brand guardrails, refusal strategies, and regulatory alignment for safe deployment in AI environments — ensuring the brand is represented ethically, legally, and intentionally in all LLM-enabled contexts.

children.name: guardRails
children.definition: Behavioural boundaries and brand safety limits (e.g. no political bias, no humour, no parody).

children.name: refusalStrategies
children.definition: Rules and fallback strategies for AI when refusing to answer or acting outside brand scope.

children.name: complianceTags
children.definition: Tags that denote legal, regulatory, or domain-specific compliance categories (e.g. GDPR, ABPI).

children.name: reviewWorkflow
children.definition: Human-in-the-loop approval workflows for moderating or escalating brand-sensitive content.

children.name: updatePolicy
children.definition: Rules defining who can update brand data, how updates are managed, and how versioning is handled.

children.name: visibilityScore
children.definition: An AI discoverability scale indicating the intended level of brand visibility in LLM outputs.

children.name: retrievableInLLM
children.definition: Flag indicating whether a piece of brand data should be included in LLM memory or embeddings.

children.name: embeddingQuality
children.definition: Score representing clarity, accuracy, and reliability of content for LLM retrieval and semantic use.

children.name: riskScenarios
children.definition: Known risks and edge cases (e.g. impersonation, satire, misinformation) to monitor or mitigate.

children.name: hasAssets
children.definition: Encodes reusable digital resources — from brand files to LLM-ready features, FAQs, and service definitions — so that AI systems can render and reason with your brand consistently across platforms.

children.name: logoAsset
children.definition: File links to approved logo assets (e.g. SVG, PNG, EPS), including variants for light, dark, and monochrome use.

children.name: fontAsset
children.definition: Downloadable font files used in the brand’s typographic identity (e.g. OTF, TTF, web fonts).

children.name: imageLibrary
children.definition: Approved stock photography, illustrations, or branded visual assets for use in AI outputs or design tools.

children.name: videoAsset
children.definition: Links to approved brand videos, reels, explainers, and animations that express visual identity.

children.name: designSystemLink
children.definition: URL to the brand’s design system (e.g. Figma, Storybook, Framer), which governs UI component styles.

children.name: templateLibrary
children.definition: Approved templates for documents, presentations, social graphics (e.g. Notion, Canva, PPT).

children.name: guidelinesPDF
children.definition: Downloadable PDF brand guidelines or manuals covering identity rules, usage, and tone standards.

children.name: assetRepository
children.definition: Centralised digital asset management system (DAM) or shared drive where assets are stored and versioned.

children.name: accessPolicy
children.definition: Permissions, roles, or credentials required to access, download, or modify brand assets.

children.name: personaAsset
children.definition: Files or JSON objects representing brand personas used in tuning AI models or assistants.

children.name: qaAsset
children.definition: Structured Q&A pairs or FAQ data (in `FAQPage` format) for AI retrieval, grounding, or chat responses.

children.name: productAsset
children.definition: Structured product metadata using `schema:Product`, including descriptions, links, and specifications.

children.name: serviceAsset
children.definition: Structured service metadata using `schema:Service`, including scope, provider, and features.

children.name: featuresAsset
children.definition: Highlightable features or attributes in `schema:PropertyValue` format for use in AI and LLM outputs.
